item.title: French Startup Bitit to Launch New Bitcoin Buying Platform
item.description:
French Startup Bitit to Launch New Bitcoin Buying Platform

Bitit is a French Bitcoin startup which keeps reinventing itself. After making a big splash by letting users buy Bitcoin through a Bitit code redeemable into Bitcoins, and with cash in 100K+ local stores, Bitit is now proposing a new killer platform which lets you buy Bitcoins in few seconds.

item.title: A $99 Trezor Could Have Prevented the $70M Bitfinex Theft
item.description:
A $99 Trezor Could Have Prevented the $70M Bitfinex Theft

The Bitfinex hack was an unfortunate time for Bitcoin users as the exchange had lost roughly $60 million USD in customer funds. Thus, the topic of security is on everyone's lips as two hardware wallet manufacturers - Also read: Australia's Postal Service Reveals 3 Blockchain Use-Cases Trezor and Ledger - are claiming that the hack could have been prevented with one affordable device.

item.title: The Tatiana Show - Anthony Di Iorio of Decentral & Matej Boda of DECENT | Lets Talk Bitcoin
item.description:
The Tatiana Show - Anthony Di Iorio of Decentral & Matej Boda of DECENT | Lets Talk Bitcoin

Tatiana and Josh interview Anthony Di Iorio of Decentral & Matej Boda of DECENT. Topics of conversation include Blockchain wallets, practical uses for ethereum, artist networks, mobile net security. -Anthony is a serial entrepreneur, public speaker and devout supporter of cryptocurrencies and blockchain and decentralized technologies.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's What's On This Evening - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's What's On This Evening - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening. In this morning's bitcoin price watch piece, we discussed the fact that action to date this week has been relatively flat, and that we were hoping to get a breakout that we could get in and out on a quick short term scalp entry and draw a profit from the market on the volatility.

item.title: Report on Global Uses of Bitcoin 2016 to Come Out Tomorrow
item.description:
Report on Global Uses of Bitcoin 2016 to Come Out Tomorrow

Jamie McCormick who runs the Bitcoin Marketing Team and BitcoinsInIreland has just released the results of their second annual global survey which took place between April and June 2016 on the uses of Bitcoin. On the question of the active use of Bitcoin 65% said they had sent or received Bitcoin in the last week while 9% of respondents had not yet used it.

item.title: Dash Accepted Here! BlockPay POS System Integrates with Dash
item.description:
Dash Accepted Here! BlockPay POS System Integrates with Dash

BlockPay has debuted a zero-fee merchant system with cryptocurrency integration, including Dash. The BlockPay is a point-of-sale (POS) system which accepts a wide variety of cryptocurrencies for zero fees, as well as traditional debit and credit cards. Among these is Dash, a cryptocurrency which places a strong emphasis on day-to-day usability, hence the name as a portmanteau of "digital" and "cash."

item.title: XCOINS.IO Automates the Process of Making Money with Bitcoin - Press Release
item.description:
XCOINS.IO Automates the Process of Making Money with Bitcoin - Press Release

Menlo Park, CA, August 5, 2016 - xCoins.io completed three months of testing of its innovative automated bitcoin system. It is not a secret that one of the most profitable ways of making money with bitcoin is selling it on peer-to-peer exchange websites at high premium.

item.title: Venezuela Will Need a Bigger Chart for Its BTC Trading Volume
item.description:
Venezuela Will Need a Bigger Chart for Its BTC Trading Volume

As its economy descends deeper into chaos, Venezuela has once again broken its own BTC trading volume in the first week of August and will probably need a bigger chart for the months ahead. Also read: Bitcoin a Reliable Alternative in Latin America Venezuela has again set a new bitcoin transaction volume record, which has seen exponential growth since the start of 2016.

item.title: Bitfinex Offers $3.6 Million Bounty in Bid to Recover Stolen Bitcoin - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitfinex Offers $3.6 Million Bounty in Bid to Recover Stolen Bitcoin - CoinDesk

Bitfinex is reportedly offering a reward worth up to $3.6m for the recovery of bitcoins stolen from its exchange last week. The Hong Kong-based digital currency exchange lost nearly 120,000 BTC in the incident (an amount worth roughly $71m at press time), and it now suggests it's willing to offer 5% of these funds (or about 6,000 BTC) as a reward should they be found and returned.

item.title: Why can't we trade in bitcoins in India?
item.description:
Why can't we trade in bitcoins in India?

"My name is Walt Cass. Dr. Walter Cass. I'm a liberal, a Democrat, and an agnostic. I'm married and have grown children. I've been a teacher for 30 years. I serve on the Board of Higher Education in Boston. (Holding up a book) I even wrote this book on Education.
